project.name: ai-tree
project.description: This plugin runs powerful, easy-to-use AI trees.

Plugins.name: Plugins
Plugins.description: AI Tree plugin, providing intuitive, powerful AI trees to the designer.

Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.name: Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree
Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.description: AI Tree plugin, providing intuitive, powerful AI trees to the designer.

Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Ai.name: Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Ai
Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Ai.description:
AI container component. Create and attach one of these to every
AI actor.

params.name: entity
params.description: The entity to which these behaviours belong.

Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.OuterNode.name: Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.OuterNode
Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.OuterNode.description:
Template for all responsive nodes. An Outer Node performs some process (usually an action or a condition check) then returns a STATUS to its caller. This STATUS dictates the entire tree traversal.

All nodes are based on the Outer Node.

Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.InnerNode.name: Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.InnerNode
Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.InnerNode.description: Inner Nodes are templates for the inner nodes that facilitate tree traveral.

props.name: shuffle
props.description: Whether the node will shuffle its children.

Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Sequencer.name: Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Sequencer
Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Sequencer.description:
Inner node. Tries to execute a sequence. Steps through children one by one.

If it reaches the end, it returns STATUS_SUCCESS.

If it receives STATUS_FAILURE it returns STATUS_FAILURE.

If it receives STATUS_RUNNING it returns STATUS_RUNNING and resumes from that node on the next update.

props.name: shuffle
props.description: Whether the node will shuffle its children

Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Selector.name: Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Selector
Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Selector.description:
Inner node. Tries to find a successful node. Steps through children.

If it receives STATUS_SUCCESS, it returns STATUS_SUCCESS.

If it reaches the end, it returns STATUS_FAILURE.

If it receives STATUS_RUNNING it returns STATUS_RUNNING and resumes from that node on the next update.

props.name: shuffle
props.description: Whether the node will shuffle its children

Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.UntilFailure.name: Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.UntilFailure
Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.UntilFailure.description:
Inner node. Tries to repeat a sequence indefinitely.

If it receives STATUS_FAILURE it returns STATUS_SUCCESS.

If it receives STATUS_RUNNING it returns STATUS_RUNNING and resumes from that node on the next update.

CAUTION: This node can loop indefinitely. Be sure to provide an escape condition.

props.name: shuffle
props.description: Whether the node will shuffle its children

Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.UntilSuccess.name: Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.UntilSuccess
Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.UntilSuccess.description:
Inner node. Tries to find a success, indefinitely.

If it receives STATUS_SUCCESS, it returns STATUS_SUCCESS.

If it receives STATUS_RUNNING it returns STATUS_RUNNING and resumes from that node on the next update.

CAUTION: This node can loop indefinitely. Be sure to provide an escape condition.

props.name: shuffle
props.description: Whether the node will shuffle its children

Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.TimeLoop.name: Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.TimeLoop
Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.TimeLoop.description:
Inner node. Runs over and over for a specific duration. This is useful for scheduling advanced tasks that are not expected to finish quickly, but do reach an acceptable approximation quickly.

If it receives STATUS_RUNNING it returns STATUS_RUNNING and resumes from that node on the next update.

Returns STATUS_SUCCESS when time runs out.

props.name: shuffle
props.description: Whether the node will shuffle its children

props.name: timerDuration
props.description:
How long the node runs,
in milliseconds

Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.TimeTrial.name: Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.TimeTrial
Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.TimeTrial.description:
Inner node. Runs over and over for a specific duration. Unlike TimeLoop, it returns if it encounters a failure. This is useful for scheduling advanced tasks that are not expected to finish quickly, but might need to stop.

If it receives STATUS_RUNNING it returns STATUS_RUNNING and resumes from that node on the next update.

If it receives STATUS_FAILURE it returns STATUS_FAILURE.

Returns STATUS_SUCCESS when time runs out.

props.name: shuffle
props.description: Whether the node will shuffle its children

props.name: timerDuration
props.description:
How long the node runs,
in milliseconds

Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Inverter.name: Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Inverter
Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Inverter.description:
Inner node. Inverts its child.

If it receives STATUS_SUCCESS it returns STATUS_FAILURE.

If it receives STATUS_FAILURE it returns STATUS_SUCCESS.

If it receives STATUS_RUNNING it returns STATUS_RUNNING.

If it has no children it returns STATUS_FAILURE. It can only have one child, and will replace it if another is added.

props.name: shuffle
props.description: Whether the node will shuffle its children

Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Success.name: Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Success
Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Success.description:
Very simple outer node that always returns STATUS_SUCCESS.
This can be useful for controlling sophisticated behaviours.
For example, if you use a Selector to perform one of a series of tasks,
none of which are guaranteed to return success, but you want the Selector
to always succeed, you can add a Success node to the end.

Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Failure.name: Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Failure
Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Failure.description:
Very simple outer node that always returns STATUS_FAILURE.
This can be useful for controlling sophisticated behaviours.
For example, if you use a Sequencer to perform a series of tasks,
but would like the Sequencer to fail for reasons of flow control,
you can add a Failure node to the end.

Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Counter.name: Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Counter
Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Counter.description:
Counter outer node. This node counts to a maximum value.

The node increments its counter by 1 and returns STATUS_FAILURE.

If the node reaches its maximum, it instead returns STATUS_SUCCESS.

This node is very useful for causing an UntilSuccess or UntilFailure node to finish after a certain number of repetitions.

classitems.description:
Uses various methods to seek the best available time in millis.
This method uses high precision time, so it is possible to specify
decimal milliseconds; however this feature is only available in compatible
browsers.
classitems.name: getTime

classitems.description:
The root node of the AI tree, where all decision-making begins.
This is the internal value and should not be accessed without
also performing the proper rebuilds via this.setRoot().
classitems.name: _root

classitems.description: Master list of all unique child nodes.
classitems.name: uniqueChildren

classitems.description: The root node of the AI tree, where all decision-making begins.
classitems.name: root

classitems.description:
Adds a child to the node tree. Because this base can only have one child,
the root, this just calls this.setRoot().
classitems.name: addChild

classitems.description:
Whether this node has a specific ancestor. Because this cannot have ancestors
by definition, always returns false.
classitems.name: hasAncestor

classitems.description: Whether this node has a specific descendant.
classitems.name: hasDescendant

classitems.description:
Attaches the root child of the node tree. This function ensures that all
connections are rebuilt. It is automatically called if "root" is
accessed directly.
classitems.name: setRoot

classitems.description: Updates the Ai tree and makes decisions. Call this once per frame.
classitems.name: update

return.description: A number, a constant referring to the status of the tree.

classitems.description: Updates the census, a list of all unique child nodes.
classitems.name: updateCensus

classitems.description:
Optional name for the node. This is not used internally, but is useful
for debugging. If it has no value given in params, it takes it
from the DEFAULT_NODE_NAME.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description:
Status regulates traveral. Inner nodes choose their next action
based on the status they receive.
classitems.name: status

classitems.description: Has the node just returned STATUS_RUNNING?
classitems.name: runningDirty

classitems.description: Does the node pass STATUS_RUNNING up the tree?
classitems.name: runsParent

classitems.description:
Any parent nodes of this node. A node may have multiple parents,
but may not create cyclic graphs.
classitems.name: parents

classitems.description: Default node name.
classitems.name: DEFAULT_NODE_NAME

classitems.description: Status of a node that has not yet run on this tree traversal.
classitems.name: STATUS_READY

classitems.description: Status of a node that will continue to run on an upcoming tree traversal.
classitems.name: STATUS_RUNNING

classitems.description: Status of a node that has succeeded in its task.
classitems.name: STATUS_SUCCESS

classitems.description: Status of a node that has failed in its task.
classitems.name: STATUS_FAILURE

classitems.description: Status of a node that has encountered an error.
classitems.name: STATUS_ERROR

classitems.description: Adds a parent to this node. Do not call directly. Does not check for cycling.
classitems.name: addParent

classitems.description: Customisable stub for Inner Node behaviors.
classitems.name: _onUpdate

classitems.description:
Removes a parent from this node. Do not call directly.
Does not check for cycling.
classitems.name: removeParent

classitems.description: Resets the tree at the end of an update
classitems.name: reset

classitems.description:
Customisable stub for Outer Node behaviours.
Override this method to create your own custom behaviours.
classitems.name: _run

classitems.description:
Runs node functionality. Returns status. Do not override this function;
use _run() to define user code.
classitems.name: update

classitems.description:
Updates the tree census. This is just a signal which activates the root
Kiwi.Plugins.AiTree.Ai object census method.
classitems.name: updateCensus

classitems.description: The child nodes of this node.
classitems.name: children

classitems.description: If the node has a running child, it is tracked here.
classitems.name: currentlyRunningNode

classitems.description: Whether the node shuffles its children every update.
classitems.name: shuffle

classitems.description: Default node name.
classitems.name: DEFAULT_NODE_NAME

classitems.description:
Passes a child node as candidate for inclusion.
Checks for validity; a child cannot be its own parent or ancestor.
Candidate is only appended if it is legal.
classitems.name: addChild

classitems.description: Returns all children and subsequent children. Does not eliminate duplicates.
classitems.name: getDescendants

classitems.description:
Recursive search for a particular node.
A node counts as its own ancestor.
classitems.name: hasAncestor

classitems.description: Returns whether a particular node is beneath this node.
classitems.name: hasDescendant

classitems.description: Shared inner node functions

classitems.description: Removes a child of this node, if it exists.
classitems.name: removeChild

classitems.description: Reorders the child array to create a random output.
